Expectation1: Communicate politely and professionally with customers
Situation1: Meeting the customer for handing over a package
Expectation2: Show love and kindness to others, following the teachings of Jesus
Situation2: They offer small gestures of kindness in daily interactions
Story: I parked my scooter in front of the apartment building, package in hand, ready to deliver it to the customer. As a delivery person, I knew I had to be polite and professional, no matter what. I rang the bell, and the door swung open. The customer barely glanced at me, snatched the package, and muttered, “You’re late,” before turning away. My cheeks burned. I wanted to snap back, to defend myself—traffic had been terrible, and I was only a few minutes behind. But then, the other part of me—the Christian part—reminded me of Jesus’ teachings: show love, offer kindness, even when it’s not returned. I felt the urge to say something gentle, maybe wish them a good day, or offer a smile. But the sting of their rudeness made it hard. I stood there, wrestling with the expectations of my job and my faith, unsure which voice to follow as the door closed in my face.
